summary: This bill, the "Wearable Equipment Adoption and Reinforcement and Investment in Technology Act" (WEAR IT Act), amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow the use of Health Savings Accounts (HSAs), Archer MSAs, and health flexible spending and reimbursement arrangements to purchase certain wearable devices. These wearable devices must collect and analyze physiological data or assist in diagnosis/treatment of health conditions. Expenses are limited to $375 per taxable year. The amendments primarily take effect after December 31, 2025.
